or even for days at time am going to screw my kids up choosing career over being with them all the time does this feeling go away as your kids get older and you can interact with them more even consider working hard for long time now and staying home when they re entering adolescence since that sometimes hard time in life and it pays to have loving parent to talk to after school removed the kids enough to make caring for other people kids their careers you will still spend ton of time with your kids you just wo have to resent the time you wish you were working do see anything wrong with home by the time that was over and could go to work again thought lost my mind do think was made to be stay at home mom just ca stand it or really think it just the monotony of doing the same things together more enjoyable and our weeknights just do you if working is what makes you happy do it you are not going to screw up your kids by demonstrating hard work to them my husband mom was getting her master when he was toddler one of his first memories is her graduation she worked full time after that he spent lot of time at the babysitter he turned out great and think he going to be great dad others work we all are well adjusted get along great have good jobs etc you most definitely will not screw up your kid by working it might screw them up if you re really unhappy all the time know what mean love your babies take care of yourself and good luck think being at home with my kids is the best thing ever she says on day when her kids are away at camp they are precious angels they are not and treasure every cup of milk that they spill and every pile of sand that they leave in my hall she treasures neither discussion about sahparenting tends to be divided between glorification and venting with little middle ground really do mostly love staying at home with my kids but they totally drive me nuts ton of the time and honestly would probably appreciate it way less if was in position to be able to have help with the cleaning and plenty of time on my own you re not going to screw anyone up anymore than we re all screwing all of our kids up in the usual ways but also caution you that judging all of staying home based on the first six months is unfair newborns are hard but as they get older they get more fun and independent and you get to do cool stuff but right now if you re happier working work you can always reevaluate later on think showing your kids to work hard and follow your dreams is great thing if you are too tired at the end of the day why not only the past few generations have had stay at home parents previously even the kids worked and babies even in really ancient tribal times stayed with grandmothers while the moms went out to forage my point is the idea that you and only you can guide your kids towards becoming normal healthy adults is rooted in myth and not reality in reality kids thrive from many healthy adult attachments mom being an important one of them but not necessarily the only one which is why the last thing on your mind should be whether it ll screw your kids up really it should be how to juggle kids work personal time marriage you can always change your mind too kids get to be lot more work once they are in school believe it or not nothing needs to be permanent or an extreme you can work part time too decided to go back to my career while was emptying the dishwasher and realized that that was the only thing was going to have to report to anyone about what did today lots of people talk about moms who have to work but trust me there are many dozens dozens of us who work because we \*\*gasp\*\* love our careers and believe we have unique skills to contribute to our fields turns out there are all kinds of options for the next steps considered becoming stay at home mom love my kid to pieces but honestly found that it would be too hard especially with the need to then do all of the housework as you describe don think you necessarily screw your kid up purely as result of choosing one or the other —rather if you are resentful as the result of particular choice that resentment may spill over toward them in short you need to pursue what will make you happiest so that you can be the best damn momma you can be banish the mom guilt we are all doing our bests ❤️💖👏 you will not screw up your kids my mom worked full time starting when was weeks old she was resident physician in the military and that all the leave she could take back then turned out just fine no crazy acting out advanced degree as emotionally psychological balanced as could hope for she gave me two pieces of advice as working mom when you get home make that time 100 amp 37 about your kids babies and little kids do need their parents around as much as pre teens and teenagers do my mom went from full time to part time when was \~14 years old was the oldest and even if that not possible alot of times careers become more flexible the longer you re in them as you get higher up position wise so it easier to take an afternoon off to go watch sports game or attend some mid day school event when was young usually at dinner
